text:
The Epistle Dedicatory.
violent? and on the contrary, upon the kind Aspects of
the Sun, Jupiter, and Venus, they be not more gentle,
mild, and refrigerating? and also, Whether the arising
of your Pleiades, Hyades, and Constellated Eagle, &c.
(chiefly when any eminent Conjunction or Aspect falls in
with them) do not certainly induce Moisture?
I beseech you (my honoured and worthy Friends) to
take some notice of these matters, which you may easily
do, by keeping a Diary of the Weather; as also of the
Effects of your Vernal Ingresses, (which I intend, God
permitting me Life, once a Year to present you withal;)
and pray ye also observe, together therewith, the Transits,
Conjunctions, &c. of the Planets over the prime parts of
your Islands Palladium, or Genesis; that they may be
preserved by your generous Communication, as well for
the advance of Truth in Science, as advantage of your Selves
and Country.
Thus, worthy Friends and Countrymen, wishing you
all Happiness, and, as so many successful Columbus's,
to encrease as well in your Acquaintance with the Influences
of the glorious Diamonds of Heaven, as in the Gold
and Treasure of the Indies; which (if St. Paul may
be credited, Rom. 1.19.) will lead ye certainly unto an
enjoyment of that Immortal Treasure, of which Saints
and Angels partake in Heaven â€” I remain,
To your Honoured Selves, and to the
Truths of Astrologie, a Real
Servant, whilst,
John Gadbury.
Brick-Court, by
the Deans-Yard,
Westminster.
The
The Names of the several GOVERNOURS
of JAMAICA, since the taking thereof
by the English, Anno 1655.
1. The Honourable Col. D'Oyley, was Governour
thereof, first after its being taken.
2. The Right Honourable the Lord of Windsore,
was Governour thereof.
3. The Honourable Sir Thomas Modyford, Knight
and Baronet, was Governour of this Noble Island;
And He it was that commanded a general Surveigh
to be taken of it, at his own Charge; and under him
it began eminently to flourish.
4. The Honourable and Valiant Sir Thomas
Lynch, Knight, succeeded Sir Thomas Modyford, and
is the present Governour thereof; and under him
hath this gallant Country happily improved.
In my next years Book, I shall (God permitting)
give you a more ample Chronology of
the Remarkables relating to this Noble Island;
together with an Account of the Commodities,
and growth thereof.
A Table
